1.title: Martha's Vineyard, Massachusetts
1.plot: Season One of this family docu-series, follows Lt. Colonel Victor Krus and his family as they cross the country on a quest to find home, sweet home. KRUSING AMERICA is the story of an American hero's search for an American hometown.

2.title: Smithfield, Virginia
2.plot: Highlights: Visiting The Darden Farm, firing a canon in Yorktown, dressing up in colonial attire for Williamsburg and Jamestown, riding The Smithfield Antique Fire Truck, sunset dinner at The Smithfield Station, Art on the Fly, Bingo at AFL, making donuts at Ringo's, and spending time with Santa at The Christmas Store. When the kids asked Santa why he was in Virginia in September? He replied, "I live in the North Pole but I summer in Smithfield!"

3.title: Stuart, Florida
3.plot: Sixty miles north of Palm Beach is a waterfront town with over 125 years of history. A charming, culturally diverse community located in one of the country's most beautiful environments. People who have withstood time and hurricanes anchor the foundation of this town. Shipwrecked sailors found solace here and so did the Krus Family.

4.title: Sonoma, California
4.plot: Highlights: Wine Country in the spring, AnnaMarie celebrates her birthday at Ramekins Cooking School, biking through the hillside, The Egg Game, egg hunting around The Plaza, visiting vineyards, riding The Sebastiani Trolley, TrainTown and making pizza at Mary's Pizza Shack. Celebrating Easter with our new friends in Sonoma, California!

5.title: Port Townsend, Washington
5.plot: Highlights: The gorgeous views of the Puget Sound, helping to build a wooden boat and steering it down The Sound, The Rhododendron Festival, participating in The Pet Parade and The Bed Races - winning prizes in both! Learning about ocean life and playing in The Bunkers - So much to do in Port Townsend, Washington.

6.title: Hannibal, Missouri
6.plot: Highlights: Fourth of July in Mark Twain's Hometown; white washing fences, meeting Tom and Becky, playing in the caves, riding down the Grand Mississippi River on a true paddle boat.
